com.percussion.utils.guid
Interface IPSGuid

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
public interface IPSGuid
extends Serializable

Guids are abstract references to internal objects. A guid generally is a globally unique identifier. For Rhythmyx, they are global by benefit of a site id that is assigned by Percussion to each user's installation and a type id defined for each supported object type.

Guids with a site id of 0 are reserved for development use.

Author:
dougrand

Method Summary
 long getHostId()
          Gets the host id, which indicates what customer installation created the object this GUID references.
 short getType()
          Return the type of the GUID, the interpretation of the type depends on the context.
 int getUUID()
          Return the UUID of the GUID.

 String toStringUntyped()

Method Detail

toStringUntyped

String toStringUntyped()
Convert a numeric guid into a user readable form with no type integer. Appropriate for times where the type is implied.

Returns:
a formatted string, never null or empty.

getHostId

long getHostId()
Gets the host id, which indicates what customer installation created the object this GUID references. Each customer should have a unique host id, which is an important part of keeping these identifiers globally unique.

Returns:
the host id component of the guid.

getType

short getType()
Return the type of the GUID, the interpretation of the type depends on the context.

Returns:
the type ordinal used for this guid.

getUUID

int getUUID()
Return the UUID of the GUID.

Returns:
the uuid without host and type information.

longValue

long longValue()
Get the guid value in raw form. This is suitable for storage in serialized objects or in the database.

If there is no hostid, then the GUID was constructed from an old id in the database. For example, you have a template with a template id of 319. When that becomes a GUID internally, it has the type added to it. If longValue() (which is used when finding a template from the GUID) doesn't strip everything but the UUID, the value won't match the value in the database. On the other hand, if the GUID is a new GUID, then the value in the database will be the complete guid, and it is appropriate for longValue() to return m_guid.

Returns:
the guid with the details as described above.
